strategy: Implement a neural network with an embedding layer for categorical features (e.g., 'Embarked', 'Cabin') and dense layers for continuous features (e.g., 'Age', 'Fare'), using dropout regularization and batch normalization to reduce overfitting. Preprocess data by imputing missing values using median imputation for continuous and mode for categorical.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from tensorflow import keras
from tensorflow.keras import layers
import tensorflow as tf

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill missing values
# Continuous features: Age, Fare
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Categorical features: Sex, Embarked
X_train['Sex'] = X_train['Sex'].map({'female': 0, 'male': 1})
X_test['Sex'] = X_test['Sex'].map({'female': 0, 'male': 1})

# Fill Embarked with mode
embarked_mode = X_train['Embarked'].mode()[0]
X_train['Embarked'].fillna(embarked_mode, inplace=True)
X_test['Embarked'] = X_test['Embarked'].fillna(embarked_mode)

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure consistent columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
X_test = X_test[common_columns]

# Normalize continuous features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

    layers.BatchNormalization(),
    layers.Dropout(0.3),

X_test['Embarked'] = X_test['Embarked'].fillna(embarked_mode)

X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Remove non-numeric columns that cause errors (Name, Ticket, Cabin)
X_train = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number])
X_test = X_test.select_dtypes(include=[np.number])

# Fill missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Ensure consistent columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
X_test = X_test[common_columns]

# Normalize continuous features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Train Random Forest model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=10, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Remove non-numeric columns that cause errors (Name, Ticket, Cabin)
X_train = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number])
X_test = X_test.select_dtypes(include=[np.number])

# Fill missing values using median
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Ensure consistent columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
X_test = X_test[common_columns]

# Normalize continuous features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Train Random Forest model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=10, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
